text.17_Daf, 0_Line, 0_Comment: He would write a bill of divorce for his wife- For if he died in war the bill would take effect retroactively from the day it was written-And it happened that Uriah [the Hittite] died in war.
text.17_Daf, 0_Line, 1_Comment: For it is written-During the war of Shaul and your brothers etc. and David learned from his father Jesse to even lead [properly] like this when going out to war
text.133_Daf, 8_Line, 0_Comment: He has [assets] and doesn't want to support himself - from his own [assets] but rather only from Tzedaka and he afflicts himself with hunger
text.2_Daf, 0_Line, 0_Comment: It is an establishment of the Rabanan that you marry a besula on Wednesday, like the Gemara will explain later on.
text.47_Daf, 10_Line, 2_Comment: For it is forbidden from a positive commandment - "So shall you bless" (Numbers 6). You [priests] and not non-priests. And a negative commandment that comes from a positive commandment is [called] a positive commandment.
text.32_Daf, 8_Line, 0_Comment: Reroute - When the bride comes out from her father's home to the wedding hall and (at the same time) those accompanying a dead body (for burial) and both groups will be shouting (one group with joy and the other in mourning) and we don't want to mix the two we reroute (those accompanying) the deceased (even) if it is to a different route.
text.2_Daf, 0_Line, 1_Comment: For twice in a week- it is discussing the maiden.
